result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L. Schneider is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L. Schneider was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Robert L. Schneider was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 2 days if revoked.
Deft is eligible for expunction after 3 years.  Deft may petition the court, in writing, in three years requesting expunction.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  Pay fine of $ 100.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges on count 3.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not have contact with Adriahna P.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violations to be reported to the Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Schneider

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  3:23pm.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Seth Johnson.  Case is resolved.  VRC.  Deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 18mos on each count concurrent.  See conditions.  If revoked, credit for 2 days KCJ is requested.  DNA ordered; notice provided to deft.  Appeal rights.  Deft is eligible for expunction after 3yrs.  Deft may petition the court, in writing, in three years requesting expunction.

Defendant, Robert L. Schneider, appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: S.Shaw.
MINUTES: Matter here on Final Pre-Trial. The parties are attempting resolution. Deft requests an adjournment. Adjournment request granted. 7/11/22 Jury Selction Adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Final pre-trial on June 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
On request of deft, FPT moved from 6/22 to 6/27; deft has a planned vacation (non refundable) from 6/14 through 6/25.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: KPD Ofc. Krueger except in professional capacity.  *No VIOLENT contact and no discussion of case w/ Adriahna P.

01:28 PM 
  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brian Rolf.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
and witness list filed by the State
